frameDefinitions: An Agent attempts to achieve a Goal using some Means.
An Agent supports their body in a particular Location.
An Evaluator participates in an Experience (or metonymically, a salient Entity of the Experience), often for the first time, in order to form an opinion about its quality.
This is an abstract frame for acts performed by sentient beings.

A  Mitigating_situation is presented as occurring against the backdrop of a more preferable situation and a less preferable situation that, while expected, feared, or hoped for, did not or will not occur; the Mitigating_situation is thus, so to speak, sandwiched between a better and a worse situation, both of which are relevant in the discourse.
An Agent attempts to achieve a Goal.
frameExamples: John <t>tried</t> using a crowbar to open the door.
Have you <t>tried</t> my latest get-rich-quick scheme? INI
<t>At least</t> I don’t have to go to school.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Agent</fen> makes an attempt to achieve a <fen>Goal</fen>.
The <fen>Goal</fen> is what the <fen>Agent</fen> attempts to achieve.
This role identifies the <fen>Means</fen> by which an attempt occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the attempt occurs.
The place where an attempt is made.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the individual whose body is in a particular posture.  The <fen>Agent</fen> role is generally expressed as the external argument of verbs:
A description of the position of the <fen>Agent</fen>.  The <fen>Location</fen> of the <fen>Agent</fen> is frequently expressed and generally occurs as a PP Complement:
The part of the body that provides support to the <fen>Agent</fen>'s body in the posture.
This role indicates the Time interval during which the <fen>Agent</fen> held a certain posture.
The person (or metonymic manifestation thereof) that participates in the <fen>Experience</fen>.
The activity or event that the <fen>Evaluator</fen> participates in.
<fen>Entity</fen> is something that the <fen>Evaluator</fen> uses to try an <fen>Experience</fen>, and metonymically stands in for the <fen>Experience</fen>.
A more explicit description of what the <fen>Evaluator</fen> seeks to learn by having the <fen>Experience</fen>.
The temporal location during which the <fen>Experience</fen> occurs.
The physical location in which the <fen>Experience</fen> occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Act</fen> that the <fen>Agent</fen> performs intentionally.
The <fen>Agent</fen> performs the intentional act.
This role identifies the time when the Agent acts intentionally.
This role identifies the place where the intentional act occurs.

The <fen>Mitigating_situation</fen> is the situation that actually occurs. It is presented in a discourse to mitigate the fact that a better situation did not occur - since the role is still preferable to an even worse situation.
The <fen>Agent</fen> makes an attempt to achieve a <fen>Goal</fen>.
The <fen>Goal</fen> is what the <fen>Agent</fen> attempts to achieve.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the attempt occurs.
The place where an attempt is made.
listRoleExamples: John tried using a crowbar <fex>to enter the locked door</fex>.
<fex>On the bridge</fex> he tried the crowbar.
I stood <fex>on my heels</fex> and looked out the window
<fex>Yesterday evening</fex> he was sitting in his armchair as usual
<fex>She</fex> tested out six cars before finding the one she liked.
Have you ever tried <fex>working out with kettlebells?</fex>
We tried out <fex>the games</fex>, and they're fun.
I tried out my neighbors vacuums <fex>to see if they met my needs</fex>
I tried it for the first time <fex>at home</fex>.
We didn't win $7 million, but at least <fex>I only lost $2 on lottery tickets</fex>.
<fex>On the bridge</fex> he attempted to put the wig on.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: greater than 7g of plute per litre
Jasper, the Joint Actinide Shock Physics Experimental Research
